4.title: Project Dependencies
4.content: . | Python 3.11 or newer | NodeJS 18 or newer | .

6.title: Backend
6.content: Setup . **Optional: Create python virtual environment . From the \backend directory: . python3 -m venv venv . To start the virtual environment (run every time you run the dev env) . Mac: . source venv/bin/activate . Windows: .\venv\Scripts\Activate.ps1 . Install dependencies . pip install -r requirements.txt . Setup environment variables .env file should be located in backend directory . # Mongo USR="username" PW="password" # JWT secrets JWT_SECRET_KEY="key" JWT_REFRESH_SECRET_KEY="key" ALGORITHM="algo" # For local dev HOST=localhost PORT=8000 OPENAI_API_KEY="key" . Run the server . # check dir # cd backend python3 main.py . Navigate to http://localhost:8000 .

7.title: Frontend
7.content: Setup . Install dependencies . npm install . Run the expo app . npm run start ## You can also run directly on your machine # npm run web # npm run ios # npm run android . Scan the qr code to access the expo app on your phone .

18.title: Web Version
18.content: This app is created using React Native and run using Expo. This means that the app is very versatile and can run on most platforms. For the simplest use case we are hosting the app directly on the web. This is intended as a mobile app. There are no plans to implement a desktop version so it is recommended to use on your phone’s browser. Scan the QR code: . or follow this link.

19.title: Run With Expo (developer experience recommended)
19.content: System Requirements . The long term goal for the app is to deploy as a mobile application. We can simulate this by running on an emulator. To run on an emulator you will need either a Mac or a Windows machine with the latest major versions installed. Software dependencies . | NodeJS 18 or newer | VS code or terminal to run Expo | Download or clone: Code Repo | Option 1 (Recommended) - Use your phone to emulate . | Expo mobile app (Android, Apple) | . | Option 2 - Emulate using a simulator . | A mobile device simulator for iOS or Android (See below) . Mac . | Xcode (Latest Version) | iOS Simulator (How to add simulators to ios) | . Windows . | Android Studio (Latest Version) | Android Simulator (How to add virtual android device) | . | . | . Install and Launch . Install dependencies. First ensure that you are in the frontend directory of the project. root/workoutApp/frontend . Run in the terminal: . npm install . Option 1: Run the app using expo. Scan the QR code from the terminal. npm run start . Option 2: Run using expo and an emulator on your machine . npm run ios . npm run android .
